intro: Anneslia bijuga, commonly known as the yellow sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are succulent, adapted to store water, and its stems are covered in fine hairs to reduce water loss. Anneslia bijuga is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to harsh, dry environments.
